posts.title: BMX Stadium Wins Awards
posts.content:
The USA BMX Hardesty National Stadium and National Headquarters, which was a Vision Tulsa project, won four awards last week.

  • Big night: The win came at the ABC (Associated Builders and Contractors) Oklahoma Excellence in Construction Awards Banquet held in Tulsa.
  • A space for everyone: They’ve hosted BMX competitive events and activities for Tulsa Parks day camp field trip last summer.

﻿

posts.title: Tulsa’s Veterans Day Parade Planning On Massive Turnout
posts.content:
Over 3,000 people are expected to attend Tulsa’s Veterans Day Parade this year.

  • Local tradition: The theme of the day is “Honoring Veteran Advocates” at 3rd and Boston at 11am on Friday, November 11th. 
  • Tribute to Normandy: The event will feature more 350 vehicles and floats and even a fly over of a WWII C-47 cargo plane.

Read on to find out HERE.

posts.title: Free Pet Wellness Fair At McClure Park
posts.content:
The Oklahoma Alliance for Animals will be offering free vaccines for our furry friends in north Tulsa on Saturday at McClure Park from 10a.m. to 2p.m.

  • Necessary care: The free pet wellness fair offering DHPP vaccines, feline FVRCP vaccines, deworming treatments and pet food on a first come first serve basis. 
  • Solving a problem: OAA reports that the Tulsa area has been dealing with a wide spread distemper issue.

For more information about the pet wellness fair HERE.

posts.title: Big Batteries Big Opportunities
posts.content:
Canoo has announced that they will be building an electric vehicle manufacturing facility in the MidAmerica Industrial Park. 

  • Coming soon: Construction will begin late 2022 with a goal of manufacturing batteries by 2023. 
  • Economic gains: The development will bring more than 2,000 jobs to the area. 

Learn more about the expansion HERE.

posts.title: Mother Road Market Celebrates 4th Birthday
posts.content:
Mother Road Market is turning four years young and they are ready to party. 

  • Family time: The festivities kick off November 12th at 11am with some family friendly fun like balloon animals, a science show and everybody’s favorite Hot Toast Music.
  • Date night: After 5pm, the adults can look forward to cocktails, bits, brewery pop ups and live music. 

Find all the details HERE.

pick.title: Tulsa Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Pitch perfect: The University of Tulsa School of Music will present Cappella Chamber Singers and TU Concert Chorale at their annual fall concert.
  • Silver screen hero: Will Rogers will return to the big screen as a character in a new movie by a Tulsa filmmaker. 
  • Our Godfather: Syvester Stallone talks about humanizing his mobster character in Tulsa King.
  • Get your name out there: we want to talk about you! Advertise with us.
